content: Got it. I'll stay in character. How can I help?
Thank you for being open to this conversation. To get started, would you like to share what’s been on your mind lately or anything you’ve been thinking about related to your health or well-being?

Honestly, it feels like everything is falling apart. My wife and I are constantly at odds because we can’t figure out how to help our son, and it’s driving a wedge between us. I want to be a good husband and father, but the stress is making me feel disconnected from everything, even my daughter who should have more of my attention.

That sounds incredibly overwhelming, like you're being pulled in so many different directions—trying to support your son, navigate things with your wife, and still be there for your daughter. It seems like you're carrying a heavy load and really care about being a good husband and father. How are you holding up through all of this?

To be honest, I feel like I'm sinking. I’m tense all the time, and even when I try to distract myself with work or something fun, I can’t focus or enjoy it. I can't see a way forward right now, and that's terrifying.

It sounds like you’re really struggling to find any sense of relief or clarity right now, and that fear of not knowing how to move forward is weighing heavily on you. It’s clear you’re trying so hard, even in the midst of everything you’re going through. What’s been keeping you going, even when it feels like this?

I guess it's just the hope that I can figure out how to help my son and somehow hold my family together—if that's even possible. I don't want to give up on any of them, but honestly, I don’t know how much longer I can handle feeling like this.

That hope you’re holding onto—the desire to support your son and keep your family together—it really shows how deeply you care about them, even in such a difficult time. It also sounds like carrying all of this alone has been exhausting and overwhelming for you. What do you think might help lighten the load, even just a little bit?
Take your time—there's no rush. Sometimes even asking that question can feel overwhelming. What’s coming up for you right now?
